fields.description: We enter an issue with an unknown 'Fix for' version.  We then decide we'll fix it for 2.5.3 (or whatever) and go to edit the issue accordingly.  The 'Fix for' version is sadly not updated!  Other fields seem to be ok.
fields.summary: Fix For version not updating
Can we have a 'Vote against' button?

fields.description: My Developers are using the Assigned to Me dashboard to tackle tasks, but it doesn't reflect versions (column not displayed on dashboard or filter view), so an issue which is major but assigned to a later release might be worked on before a minor issue assigned to the current version being developed.  Need to display/sort by release in addition to priority to reflect true work needing to be done.
fields.summary: Sort issues "assigned to me" by priority and version

fields.description:
I find the status of "Assigned" and the Assignee as "Unassigned" very confusing.

I would like to suggest that you replace the "Assigned" status with a status of "Open" and have a separrate field for the Assignee. This would make more sense to me.

This change would also enable the ability to resolve a issue and assign it to somebody for closing.
fields.summary: Replace "Assigned" status with "Open" and add Assignee field

fields.description: The component that you select is ignore when select "swap current issues to component" option when deleting a component.  Insteasd the issues realating the the deleting component have no component assigned.
fields.summary: Swap current issues to component does not work when deleting a component

Steps to duplicate: 
I opened JIRA, when to the project, clicked on roadmap, clicked on "unassigned" and received this exception.  Log file attached.
fields.summary: Exception when clicking on Unassigned issued

fields.description:
When trying JIRA, a number of users with access to more than one project have created issues in the wrong project. We would therefore like to have the possibility of moving issues between projects, along with attachments.

I'm thinking about a new permission, named "Move Issues": this permission could be assigned to the jira-administrators group. When an user in the jira-administrators group would view an issue's detail, she would also have a button named "Move Issue": clicking this button would lead to a form with a drop-down menu of projects and a Confirm button. Clicking the Confirm button would essentially create a new issue in the destination project and delete the issue in the original project.

The new issue in the destination project could have sensible defaults, such as Components = None and Version = None; attachments should be moved also, from the directory of the original project to the directory of the destination project.
fields.summary: Move issues between projects

Need to upgrade JIRA to latest ofbiz cvs

The following line seems to bee missing on line 47 in fieldtype-postgres72.xml:
<field-type-def type="integer" sql-type="NUMERIC(9,0)" java-type="Integer"><validate name="isSignedLong" /></field-type-def>

Without this, the startup failes very much.

fields.description:
shutdown.bat produces this:

-------------------------
Shutting down server localhost:8080
Shutdown complete
Press any key to continue . . .
-------------------------
 
But... the original DOS window opened by run.bat stays open with no visible impact.
 
The JIRA install is still fully functional.

If I 'cntrl-c' in the original window (the one opened with run.bat), then a huge scroll ensues, here is a snip from the last bit:

-------------------------

15:21:16,515 INFO  [MainDeployer] Undeployed 38 deployed packages
15:21:16,531 INFO  [Server] Shutting down all services
Shutting down
15:21:16,531 INFO  [ServiceController] Stopping 3 services
15:21:16,531 INFO  [SARDeployer] Stopping
15:21:16,531 INFO  [MainDeployer] Removing deployer: org.jboss.deployment.SARDeployer@38f82d
15:21:16,546 INFO  [SARDeployer] Stopped

15:21:16,546 INFO  [MainDeployer] Stopping
15:21:16,562 INFO  [MainDeployer] Stopped
15:21:16,562 INFO  [ServiceController] Stopped 3 services
15:21:16,562 INFO  [Server] Shutdown complete
Shutdown complete
Halting VM
Terminate batch job (Y/N)?

-------------------------

entering 'y' will kill the DOS window.  But still, JIRA is browsable as long as that page has already been compiled. Images don't show up, and the CSS info is kaput.  But there is *something* still running.
 
A reboot is the only way I have figured to kill this. 
 
Any thoughts?

fields.description:
We use JIRA for an internal development team and I am responsible for managing the team. One problem I have with JIRA is it is hard to determine the overall workload for the various team members. You can do this at a project level by the breakdown by assignee but there is no complete overall view.

This could be similar to the porject overview screen but provide a summary of all poprjects showing different breakdowns like...

Summary by porject
Project A   4 issues (0 in progress)
Project B   7 issues (5 in porgress)
Project C   2 issues (1 in progress)

Summary by assignee
Person 1    90 issues (20 in progress)
Person 2     5 issues (3 in progress)
Person 3     2 issues (2 in progrss)
Unasigned  300 isseus

Summary by Status

Summary by Priority

This would be a massive help. Currently we have around 25 projects defined in JIRA and I have had to create some reports using Crystl Reports Writer to help manage the overall picture.  This will do in the interim but I can't really get what I want out of the crystal reports as the JIRA data model is not really deisgned for traditional reporting (other than from JIRA itself).
fields.summary: Provide a complete overview screen rather than project overview

I find the general issue-viewing screen to be somewhat unorganized.

Putting all active links in a common place (ie, left nav) would make finding things easier than having links in-line with descriptions.

If you want descriptions, can we do tooltips or something with a:hover?

fields.description:
I assign work to developers on a weekly basis, and also assign defects to be included in a weekly release. It is way too many clicks to edit each defect for those two tasks. 

I would much prefer a list of defects, with which I can select an assignment and a fix version from drop down columms with a button at the bottom to effect all the assignments with one click (just one approach).

If you then enter an issue ref in 'View Issue' the left column remains while displaying the issue inteh right column. Correct behaviour?

fields.description:
Jira currently creates a title based on the company name(?) and then the specific page context. eg:

    "My Long Company Name - Project: Cool Stuff"

When using a brower that supports tabs (eg, Mozilla, NetCaptor) the tab title is basically useless as all the pages have the same beginning title text.

Inverting the page context and the company name would help a lot. Inverting the page context information would also help. So instead of:

   "Project: Cool Stuff - My Long Company Name"
   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    (size of tab)

It would be:

   "Cool Stuff (project) - My Long Company Name"
   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^

In which case the tab provides a good clue as to the page contents.
fields.summary: Invert page titles information

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to see the list of who is watching a particular issue, and also (depending on project settings and/or security of course) be able to add another user to the watch list.

We have started to use JIRA internally for our operations ticketing system - its working extremely well. I just notice though that when we have to create an issue ourselves due to a call-in or hall conversation that users don't end up adding themselves to the watch list, so we end up having to double-enter any status/info changes both in JIRA and in a separate email.

It's also nice to know when our VP is watching an issue. :-)

fields.description:
I would like to suggest that if JIRA loads the user details (id and password) from a cookie and attempts to authenticate and fails then JIRA should delete the cookie.

The logic behind this is:
We are using LDAP for authentication to Novell's NDS and if a user gets JIRA to remember their id and password (by saving a cookie). When the user changes their NDS password (as it expires every 20 days) and the user then attempts to get into JIRA. JIRA will load the cookie with the old password and lock the user's NDS account dur to too many failed login attemtps.

With the suggested change there would be only one failed login attempt and the user would be promoted to login which they would be able to do with their new password. 

Greg.
fields.summary: Have JIRA delete cookie when user authentication fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-690].
  {panel}

Email Confirmation
-------------------
Why:

1. To discourage nasties from registering as a third person [who is not himself]
2. To discourage frivilous use of issue submittal. (This assumes that a user will be more inclined to create "good" issues if he knows his identity is known.)
3. To satisfy corporate edicts. (Fortunately, I am not under any editcs :-)

How:

1. User enters registration information (just like now)
2. Jira creates a user object in the database in an "unconfirmed" state with an associated "confirmation code".
3. Jira notfies the user that an email has been sent containing a confirmation code/link. Jira sends the email to the user.
4. User receives confirmation email, clicks on confirmation link. 
5. Jira servlet at url specified in email receives confirmation code, and "confirms" user registration.
6. User can now login in to Jira

4a. User receives email, but was not the one who registered.
4b. User optionally contacts Jira admin, who can, if required, attempt to track down the perpitrator.

Admin Confirmation
-------------------
Why:

1. To ensure that only customers can view issues. (This is much less a priority, as groups can be used to provide access control to projects.)

How:

1. User enters registration information (just like now)
2. Jira creates a user object in the database in an "unapproved" state.
3. Jira notfies the user that an email will be sent once his registration has been approved. 
4. Jira sends the email to admin and/or provides list of registrations required via an admin page.
5. Admin approves via email or admin page.
6. Jira changes user registration to "approved" state and sends email notice to user.
6. User can now login in to Jira

5a. Admin does not approve registration, and specifies a reason.
5b. Jira sends "too bad" email to user
fields.summary: Registration that requires email response and/or admin response

For each setting, require specifying defaults for project, isuse type, priority, components, version, assigned to. The subject of the email becomes the summary, the description the body of the email message and either put the email headers in the description at the top or just overload the environment field.

fields.description:
Problem: 

"ERROR: Weblogic tx factory methods not compiled in: change comments in org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.WeblogicFactory.java and compile with weblogic.jar on the classpath."

This is due to the fact that Weblogic classes aren't included in the OfBiz distribution, and to build, you need to have weblogic.jar in the classpath.
fields.summary: Weblogic Transaction Factory not compiled into OfBiz

fields.description:
(From Jesper Rasmussen via email):

I went through the initial setup without any visible problems though the following was written to the console:

After the setup when i tried to login by accessing the /jira/ url i got this error:

500 Internal Server Error
Error parsing JSP page /jira/secure/views/dashboard.jsp

Error creating jsp-page instance: java.lang.ClassFormatError: __jspPage14_secure_views_dashboard_jsp (Code of a method longer than 65535 bytes)

On the same machine with the same config i have Orion 1.5.4 running which seems to run fine, so i guess the problem is 1.6.0 related. I dont know wethe ror not jira actually supports 1.6.0, so i just wanted to let you know, that it is not wrinkle free :)
fields.summary: Dashboard doesn't compile under orion 1.6.0
